column1: 0,pcs7_compendium_part_a_en-US_en-US.txt,112,e4a2f30a76b5753b4feb8eaf5ccba78e5a0a3da3aa9bf5e85c406ddac657ad65,"Buffers for later expansions must also be figured in.
- The benefit with this option: There is no additional computer required.
- Furthermore only maintenance licenses are required and no additional OS server licenses.
- Plant with three or more servers
- The benefit with this option: Clear assignment for the MS servers to the ""diagnostics area"" and not to plant areas
- More transparent handling: When the MS server is loaded, for example, this has no effect on the plant areas, which always have to be available to the operator.
- High flexibility due to separation, such as for upgrading the plant
The following chart shows the settings which must be checked and adapted where necessary for monitoring the components with the maintenance station:

column4: Comment

column2: Regional language and Language for display devices
column4: • Set a language in which the OS project is to be operated in process control.
• <=14 characters
• No spaces
• Message number range must be the same for all S7 programs in the multi-project/project • The name of an S7 program may not be assigned twice
The channel blocks must be at least of version V6.1. Use a corresponding library, if necessary.
Area-oriented
The settings of the plant hierarchy must be the same in all projects of the multiproject/project.

column2: OS project type single station project (2)
column4: The single station project type must be selected in project properties.
When user diagnostics is used, the group display hierarchy must be automatically created.

column1: (1) Only applies to MS Basic and MS Standard
(2) Only applies to SIMATIC MS PDM

The configuration and the related requirements which must be met are described in detail in the ""Process Control System PCS 7 Maintenance Station"" (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/109748697) manual.
In the ""MS server as separate computer"" option you create a separate project in the multiproject for the PC stations for asset management.

The data present in the multiproject serves as the basis for asset management (diagnostics blocks, HW Config, system charts with diagnostic blocks and PDM). The names of the components in the diagnostics area are derived from the names of the components in HW Config and PDM. ",What are the benefits of configuring buffers for later expansions according to the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?,No additional computer is required and only maintenance licenses are needed without additional OS server licenses.,"The main advantage is the elimination of the need for an extra computer and the requirement for just maintenance licenses, avoiding extra OS server licenses.","Benefits include saving on additional computers and only needing maintenance licenses, not additional OS server licenses.","It offers the benefit of not requiring another computer and necessitates only maintenance licenses, with no extra OS server licenses.","The configuration avoids the need for an additional computer and limits licensing requirements to maintenance licenses only, excluding additional OS server licenses."

- High flexibility due to separation, such as for upgrading the plant

",What are the advantages of using an MS server as a separate computer as described in the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?,"Clear assignment to the diagnostics area, no impact on plant areas, and high flexibility for upgrades.","It allows for a distinct allocation to diagnostics, ensures plant areas remain unaffected, and provides upgrade flexibility.","Advantages include dedicated diagnostics area assignment, isolation from plant operational areas, and enhanced upgrade flexibility.","The setup ensures diagnostics area specificity, operational integrity of plant areas, and adaptability for system enhancements.","Key benefits are diagnostics-focused server use, uninterrupted plant area availability, and ease of system upgrades."

",What settings must be checked and adapted for monitoring components with the maintenance station in the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?,"Regional language, AS station name, component designations, S7 program settings, channel blocks version, OS compilation mode, plant hierarchy, OS project type, and group display hierarchy.","Essential settings include language preferences, station naming conventions, component naming rules, program message ranges, block versions, compilation modes, hierarchy consistency, project types, and display hierarchies.","Monitoring requires adjustments in language settings, station and component names, S7 program configurations, channel block versions, OS modes, hierarchy settings, project types, and display hierarchies.","Adjustments needed span language and display settings, naming standards for stations and components, program message ranges, block versions, area-oriented compilation, hierarchy uniformity, single station project selection, and automatic hierarchy creation.","Critical checks involve setting operational languages, adhering to naming limits, ensuring message range uniformity, using correct block versions, selecting area-oriented modes, maintaining hierarchy consistency, choosing appropriate project types, and enabling automatic hierarchy displays."
